game_information {
   game_name = "The Red Soldier";
   game_version = "0.4.0";
   game_shortname = "CHPuzzle11";
   written_by = "Manda Whitney and Dan Egnor";
   uuid = "c6f4ccca-2f7f-4e4e-940f-ba5633fb86ed";
   year_of_release = "2021";
   short_synopsis = "Part of the 2021 Cryptex Hunt";
}

game_settings {
   experimental_new_scroll = "false";
   inventory_items_limit_var = "inventory_limit";
}

themes {
   t: theme {
      colors status_bar_pen="0" status_bar_paper="15";
      screen status_bar_padding_horz="1" padding_horz="1";
      status_bar { :header_text; }
      system_messages prompt=">> " question_prompt_char="Your answer? ";
      theme_settings {
         layout = "SB G LOCK D";
         failure_jingle = "on";
         success_jingle = "on";
         losegame_jingle = "on";
         wingame_jingle = "on";
      }
   }
}

#
# Rooms and layout
#

start_at = "outside";

loading_screen = "loading_screen";

locations {
   cellar: location {
      header = "Cellar";
      on_describe {
         :print "The cellar is a little damp and a lot dusty. There's a washroom to the <east<14>>, or you can go back <up<14>> to the main floor.";
         :if (night1_awake && !night1_kitchen_visited) {
            :print "You hear soft clattering from somewhere upstairs.";
         }
         :if (night2_returned && !day3_awake) {
            :print "Unlike the night before, the <computer<5>> seems to be running. There is a faint sound coming from the <headphones<5>>.";
         } :else_if (day3_awake) {
            :print "The <computer<5>> is still running from last night, with the same sound from the <headphones<5>>.";
         }
      }
   }

   cellar_stairs: location {
      header = "Stairs to Cellar";
      on_describe {
         :print "A sketchy flight of stairs leads <down<14>> to the cellar from here, or you can go <east<14>> to the kitchen or <south<14>> to the dining room.";
         :if (night1_awake && !night1_kitchen_visited) {
            :print "The clattering is definitely coming from the kitchen.";
         }
      }
   }

   dining_room: location {
      header = "Dining Room";
      on_describe {
         :if (!day1_slept || (day2_awake && !night2_returned) || day3_awake) {
            :print "The quaint pub-style dining room feels warm and inviting. There is an <antique hutch<5>> in one corner with a <plaque<5>> on the front. You see the lobby to the <east<14>> and cellar stairs to the <north<14>>.";
         } :else {
            :print "You almost trip over a chair in the dark. You can still make out the <hutch<5>> and its <plaque<5>>. The lobby is <east<14>> and the cellar stairs to the <north<14>>.";
            :if (!night1_kitchen_visited) {
               :print "You hear clattering from a nearby room.";
            }
         }
      }
   }

   hallway_east: location {
      header = "Upstairs Hallway East";
      on_describe {
         :print "This is the east end of the hotel hallway. There's a <clock<5>> on the wall with a <plaque<5>> under it. The hallway leads <west<14>>, there's a locked guest room to the south, and stairs lead <down<14>> to the lobby.";
         :if (night1_awake && !night1_kitchen_visited) {
            :print "The boards creak loudly under your feet. The clattering continues downstairs.";
         }
      }
   }

   hallway_west: location {
      header = "Upstairs Hallway West";
      on_describe {
         :print "This is the west end of the hotel hallway. Your own hotel room is to the <west<14>>, the hallway leads <east<14>>, and there's a locked guest room to the south.";
         :if (night1_awake && !night1_kitchen_visited) {
            :print "There is another thump from downstairs, followed by clattering...";
         }
      }
   }

   hidden_room: location {
      header = "Hidden Cellar Room";
      on_describe {
         :if (!hidden_room_lit) {
            :print "The hidden room is pitch black and you can't see a thing. It smells musty.";
         } :else_if  (!night2_box_open) {
            :print "Thick layers of dust cover a table and some shelves. On the table is an elaborate <box<5>>.";
         } :else_if (is_beside("letter") && is_beside("necklace")) {
            :print "Thick layers of dust cover a table and some shelves. An elaborate <box<5>> sits open on the table with an old <letter<4>> and a golden <necklace<4>> inside.";
         } :else_if (is_beside("letter")) {
            :print "Thick layers of dust cover a table and some shelves. An elaborate <box<5>> sits open on the table with an old <letter<4>> inside.";
         } :else_if (is_beside("necklace") && !is_present("daniel")) {
            :print "Thick layers of dust cover a table and some shelves. An elaborate <box<5>> sits open on the table with a golden <necklace<4>> inside.";
         } :else  {
            :print "Thick layers of dust cover a table and some shelves. An elaborate <box<5>> sits open on the table, empty.";
         }
         :if (!night2_daniel_conked) {
            :print "The bathroom is <north<14>>, back through the secret door.";
         } :else {
            :print "You can see <Daniel<5>> lying unconscious through the secret door to the <north<14>>.";
         }
      }
   }

   guest_room_1: location {
      header = "Guest Room 1";
      on_describe {
         :if (is_first_entered()) {
            :success;
            :print "You use the <stolen keys<4>> to sneak into the room.";
         }

         :print "Judging by the equipment, this was <Daniel<5>>'s guest room. His stuff is all over, but a <log book<5>> on the table catches your eye...";
      }
   }

   guest_room_2: location {
      header = "Guest Room 2";
      on_describe {
         :if (is_first_entered()) {
            :success;
            :print "You use the <stolen keys<4>> to sneak into the room.";
         }

         :print "This is a guest room just like yours, but unoccupied; a <speaker<5>> is has been placed near a <heating vent<5>>.";
      }
   }

   guest_room_3: location {
      header = "Guest Room 3 (Your Room)";
      on_describe {
         :if (!day1_slept) {
            :print "Your guest room is small but sufficient, with a hotel <bed<5>> and the usual accessories.";
         } :else_if (day1_slept && !night1_awake) {
            :set_true "night1_awake";
            :print "A loud thump jolts you out of your sleep.";
            :print "You think nothing of it, and try to go back to sleep.";
            :press_any_key;
            :print "There is another thump. And then another. It seems to be coming from downstairs. Maybe you should check it out?";
         } :else_if (night1_slept && !day2_awake) {
            :set_true "day2_awake";
            :print "You wake up. In the daylight the room is back to its cheery coziness.";
            :print "You have some time before the convention begins. Time to get some answers. Who does this <button<4>> belong to? You should examine the staff and show it to them. And what does this recording mean? You're sure people would be interested in hearing it.";
         } :else_if (night2_slept && !day3_awake) {
            :set_true "day3_awake";
            :print "You wake up several hours later. You figure you should talk to <Joyce<5>> about last night.";
         } :else {
            :print "This is your familiar hotel room.";
         }

         :if (is_present("sound")) {
            :print "You still hear that <eerie sound<5>> from the <vent<5>>...";
         } :else {
            :print "There's a hallway door to the <east<14>>.";
         }
      }
   }

   kitchen: location {
      header = "Hotel Kitchen";
      on_describe {
         :if (!(night1_awake && !day2_awake)) {
            :print "This is the inn's kitchen, cluttered with supplies and implements. Cellar stairs are to the <west<14>>, and the lobby is <south<14>>.";
         } :else {
            :if (!night1_kitchen_visited) {
               :set_true "night1_kitchen_visited";
               :print "You hold your breath and tense up as you approach the kitchen door. The clattering sounds are very clear now. Your heart practically leaps out of your chest as you turn the doorknob...";
               :press_any_key;
               :print "The clattering stops the moment you enter the room. The single security light that is on illuminates the area just enough to reveal the damage.";
               :press_any_key;
            } :else {
               :print "This is the kitchen, but something is very strange.";
            }

            :print "Drawers seem to be wrenched open. Various forks and spoons are wedged in between the countertop and the wall. And on the cupboards, written in bright red, is a <message<5>>: \"GET OUT\". It drips off of the cupboards and onto the counter.";

            :print "The cellar stairs are <west<14>>, and the lobby is <south<14>>.";
         }
      }
   }

   lobby: location { 
      header = "Hotel Lobby";
      on_describe {
         :if (!day1_lobby_visited) {
            :set_true "day1_lobby_visited";
            :print "As you enter, your eyes adjust to the dim light of the Red Soldier Inn's lobby.";
         }

         :if (!day1_slept || (day2_awake && !night2_returned) || day3_awake) {
            :print "Despite the somewhat worn look, the lobby seems very welcoming. On the wall is an oil <painting<5>> with a <plaque<5>> under it. There are some <pamphlets<4>> on the lobby <desk<5>>.";

            :if (day1_checkin_done) {
               :print "You can see a quaint little dining room to the <west<14>>, the hotel kitchen to the <north<14>>, some rickety steps <up<14>> to the guest rooms, and the hotel exit to the <east<14>>.";
            }
         } :else {
            :print "The lobby seems far less inviting at night. You can still make out the oil <painting<5>>, <plaque<5>> and <pamphlets<4>>. You could make your way <west<14>> to the dining room, <north<14>> to the kitchen, or back <up<14>> to the guest rooms.";

            :if (!night1_kitchen_visited) {
               :print "The clattering is definitely coming from the kitchen.";
            }
         }
      }
   }

   outside: location {
      header = "Outside the Red Soldier";
      on_describe {
         :if (!night2_returned) {
            :print "You approach a quaint but somewhat rundown-looking inn. A sign swings over the door: \"The Red Soldier\".";
            :press_any_key;
            :print "It was a long bus ride to get here. You're just thankful there is a bed in your immediate future.";
            :press_any_key;
            :print "(Type <ENTER<14>> to go inside.)";
         } :else {
            :print "You get back to the inn later in the night. It is devoid of people, which is perfect for you. Now is the perfect time to snoop!";
            :press_any_key;
            :print "(Type <ENTER<14>> to go inside.)";
         }
      }
   }

   washroom: location {
      header = "Public Washroom";
      on_describe {
         :if (!night2_papers_combined) {
            :print "This is the inn's public washroom. You've seen better, but you've also seen a lot worse. You can exit <west<14>> to the cellar.";
         } :else_if (!hidden_room_opened) {
            :print "The washroom is even creepier at night. The <bricks<5>> here sure do look familiar...";
         } :else {
            :print "This previously ordinary washroom now has a secret passage to the <south<14>>! You can also exit <west<14>> to the cellar.";
         }
         :if (night1_awake && !night1_kitchen_visited) {
            :print "You hear soft clattering from somewhere upstairs.";
         }
      }
   }
}

connections {
   from, direction, to = [
      cellar, east, washroom,
      cellar, leave, cellar_stairs,
      cellar, up, cellar_stairs,

      cellar_stairs, east, kitchen,
      cellar_stairs, south, dining_room,

      dining_room, east, lobby,

      hallway_east, down, lobby,
      hallway_east, south, guest_room_1,
      hallway_east, west, hallway_west,
      hallway_west, south, guest_room_2,
      hallway_west, west, guest_room_3,

      guest_room_1, leave_oneway, hallway_east,
      guest_room_2, leave_oneway, hallway_west,
      guest_room_3, leave_oneway, hallway_west,

      kitchen, south, lobby,

      outside, enter, lobby,
      outside, west, lobby,

      washroom, leave, cellar,
      washroom, south, hidden_room,

      hidden_room, leave, washroom,
   ]
}

barriers {
   stay_in_lobby_until_checked_in :block {
      block_when_not = "day1_checkin_done";
      message = "You should check into the hotel before roaming around...";
   }

   do_not_go_outside :block {
      location = "outside";
      message = "Brr! You're not going out into the cold until it's time for Gamecon.";
   }

   hidden_room_opening :block {
      location = "hidden_room";
      block_when_not = "hidden_room_opened";
   }

   daniel_blocks_exit :block {
      block_when = "night2_daniel_threatening";
      message = "You can't go anywhere with <Daniel<5>> waving that <gun<5>> at you!";
   }

   do_not_leave_letter_unread :block_path {
      from = "washroom";
      to = "cellar";
      block_when = "night2_letter_unread";
      message = "Before you leave, aren't you curious what the <letter<4>> says?";
   }

   do_not_leave_necklace_behind :block_path {
      from = "washroom";
      to = "cellar";
      block_when = "night2_necklace_dropped";
      message = "Are you going to leave the <necklace<4>> behind?";
   }

   guest_room_1_locked :block {
      location = "guest_room_1";
      block_when_not_carried = "stolen_keys";
      message = "This guest room is locked.";
   }

   guest_room_2_locked :block {
      location = "guest_room_2";
      block_when_not_carried = "stolen_keys";
      message = "This guest room is locked.";
   }
}

#
# Objects, scenery and NPCs
#

objects {
   bed: scenery "a hotel <bed<5>>" at="guest_room_3" conspicuous="false" msg="The <bed<5>> looks soft and comfortable.";

   box: scenery "an elaborate <box<5>>" conspicuous="false" msg="The <box<5>> is quite dusty, ornately carved, and apparently very old. It has a hinged lid.";

   brick_wall: scenery "a brick <wall<5>>" at="washroom" conspicuous="false" msg="The brick <wall<5>> of the washroom doesn't seem very special.";

   button: object "a shirt <button<4>> you found with the creepy message" msg="This shirt <button<4>> seems to have fallen off someone's clothes. (<EXAMINE<14>> everyone when you can!)";

   china: scenery "some fine <china<5>>" at="dining_room" conspicuous="false";

   clock: scenery "an antique <clock<5>>" at="hallway_east" conspicuous="false";

   clock_paper: object "a slip of <paper<4>> from the <clock<5>>" msg="There are lines on the old-looking <paper<4>>, but they don't make much sense on their own.";

   clock_plaque: scenery "the <plaque<5>> below the <clock<5>>" at="hallway_east" conspicuous="false" msg="The <plaque<5>> below the <clock<5>> reads: \"This clock, owned by the late Captain Sunders himself, is a fine example of early-19th-century craftsmanship. Unfortunately this particular clock no longer runs, so don't set your watch by it!\"";

   computer: scenery "a <computer<5>>" at="cellar" conspicuous="false";

   computer_headphones: scenery "<headphones<5>> attached to the <computer<5>>" at="cellar" conspicuous="false";

   creepy_message: scenery "a <message<5>> smeared on some cupboards" conspicuous="false";

   daniel: scenery "<Daniel<5>>" at="cellar" conspicuous="false";

   desk: scenery "the hotel front <desk<5>>" at="lobby" conspicuous="false" msg="The front <desk<5>> isn't fancy but it is solid. The nameplate says \"Joyce\" and looks like it doesn't get changed much.";

   haley: scenery "<Haley<5>>" at="kitchen" conspicuous="false";

   vent_1: scenery "a heating <vent<5>>" at="guest_room_3" conspicuous="false" msg="The heating <vent<5>> looks totally ordinary, and you have no way to remove it.";

   vent_2: scenery "a heating <vent<5>>" at="guest_room_2" conspicuous="false" msg="The heating <vent<5>> looks totally ordinary, and is probably linked to the one in your room.";

   hutch: scenery "an antique <hutch<5>>" at="dining_room" conspicuous="false";

   hutch_paper: object "a slip of <paper<4>> from the <hutch<5>>" msg="There are lines on the old-looking <paper<4>>, but they don't make much sense on their own.";

   hutch_plaque: scenery "the <plaque<5>> on the <hutch<5>>" at="dining_room" conspicuous="false" msg="The <plaque<5>> on the <hutch<5>> reads: \"This hutch is one of the few surviving pieces belonging to Captain Sunders. Specially crafted for the inn, it has remained here in accordance with Sunders' will.\"";

   joyce: scenery "<Joyce<5>>" at="lobby" conspicuous="false";

   letter: object "an old <letter<4>>" conspicuous="false";

   light: scenery "a flickering <light<5>>" at="washroom" conspicuous="false" msg="The flickering bathroom <light<5>> doesn't seem very interesting.";

   log_book: scenery "a <log book<5>>" at="guest_room_1" conspicuous="false";

   necklace: object "a golden <necklace<4>>" conspicuous="false" msg="The <necklace<4>> feels like solid gold. It must be worth a fortune!";

   nora: scenery "<Nora<5>>" at="dining_room" conspicuous="false";

   messages: object "some old <messages<4>>" conspicuous="false";

   painting: scenery "an oil <painting<5>>" at="lobby" conspicuous="false";

   painting_paper: object "a slip of <paper<4>> from the <painting<5>>" msg="There are lines on the old-looking <paper<4>>, but they don't make much sense on their own.";

   painting_plaque: scenery "the <plaque<5>> below the <painting<5>>" at="lobby" conspicuous="false" msg="The <plaque<5>> below the <painting<5>> reads: \"An original portrait of Captain Sunders, the original builder, owner, and now namesake of the Red Soldier inn. This was completed shortly before his death during the War of 1812.\"";

   pamphlet: object "an informational <pamphlet<4>>" at="lobby" conspicuous="false";

   phone: object "your mobile <phone<4>>" at="inventory" msg="You will never let your beloved <phone<4>> go!";

   poem: object "a <poem<4>> written on old paper";

   recipe: object "a <recipe<4>> for scones";

   room_keys: object "your hotel <room keys<4>>" msg="This hotel is old enough to have real <room keys<4>>, not some newfangled swipey card.";

   scones: object "some delicious Captain Sunders <scones<4>>" msg="These <scones<4>> are incredibly buttery and fluffy.";

   sound: scenery "an eerie <sound<5>>" conspicuous="false" msg="The <sound<5>> is strange, distorted, and decidedly creepy. It might be words but it's too soft to make out.";

   speaker: scenery "a <speaker<5>> setup" at="guest_room_2" conspicuous="false" msg="A <speaker<5>> is rigged up with some electronics, probably to play those creepy sounds.";

   stolen_keys: object "<stolen keys<4>> to all the guest rooms" msg="<Daniel<5>> must have stolen these <keys<4>> to all three guest rooms (including yours!).";

   recorder: object "a voice <recorder<4>>" msg="<Daniel<5>> gave you this <recorder<4>> to capture and amplify \"unusual\" noises, and you took it to humour him. You can use it to <RECORD SOUND<14>> and <PLAY SOUND<14>>.";
}

on_render {
   :if ((day1_slept && !night1_slept) || (night2_returned && !night2_slept)) {
       :if (is_at("cellar")) {:overlay "cellar_night";}
       :if (is_at("cellar_stairs")) {:overlay "cellar_stairs_night";}
       :if (is_at("dining_room")) {:overlay "dining_room_night";}
       :if (is_at("hallway_east")) {:overlay "hallway_east_night";}
       :if (is_at("hallway_west")) {:overlay "hallway_west_night";}
       :if (is_at("guest_room_3")) {:overlay "guest_room_3_night";}
       :if (is_at("kitchen")) {:overlay "kitchen_night";}
       :if (is_at("lobby")) {:overlay "lobby_night";}
   }

   :if (day1_slept && !night1_slept) {
       :if (is_at("kitchen")) {:overlay "kitchen_getout";}
   }

   :if (is_at("cellar") && is_present("daniel")) {:overlay "cellar_daniel";}
   :if (is_at("dining_room") && is_present("nora")) {:overlay "dining_room_nora";}
   :if (is_at("hallway_east") && !is_carried("clock_paper")) {:overlay "clock_hour3";}
   :if (is_at("hallway_east") && is_carried("clock_paper")) {:overlay "clock105";}
   :if (is_at("hidden_room") && !hidden_room_lit) {:overlay "hidden_room_dark";}
   :if (is_at("hidden_room") && is_present("daniel") && night2_daniel_threatening) {:overlay "hidden_room_daniel_gun";}
   :if (is_at("kitchen") && is_present("haley") && !(day2_awake && !day3_awake)) {:overlay "kitchen_haley";}
   :if (is_at("kitchen") && is_present("haley") && day2_awake && !day3_awake) {:overlay "kitchen_haley_nobutton";}
   :if (is_at("lobby") && is_present("joyce")) {:overlay "lobby_joyce";}
   :if (is_at("washroom") && is_present("daniel") && night2_daniel_conked) {:overlay "washroom_daniel_down";}
}

on_describe {
   #
   # Description for objects, scenery, and NPCs
   #

   :if (is_present("daniel")) {
      :if (!day1_slept) {
         :if (!day1_daniel_met) {
            :set_true "day1_daniel_met";
            :print "A portly gentleman hunched over some equipment must be <Daniel<5>> like <Joyce<5>> had mentioned.";
         } :else_if (!day1_daniel_done) {
            :print "<Daniel<5>> glances at you warily before going back to his equipment.";
         } :else {
            :print "<Daniel<5>> works on his equipment.";
         }
      } :else_if (!night2_daniel_threatening && !night2_daniel_conked) {
         :print "<Daniel<5>> fusses with his equipment in the corner.";
      } :else_if (night2_daniel_threatening) {
         :print "<Daniel<5>> is holding a <gun<5>>, with a hint of a smirk on his lips.";
      } :else_if (night2_daniel_conked) {
         :if (is_beside("necklace")) {
            :print "<Daniel<5>> lies unconscious on the floor, a golden <necklace<4>> spilled from his hands.";
         } :else {
            :print "<Daniel<5>> lies unconscious on the floor.";
         }
      }
   }

   :if (is_present("haley")) {
      :if (!day1_slept) {
         :if (!day1_haley_met) {
            :set_true "day1_haley_met";
            :print "A young woman making tea must be <Joyce<5>>'s daughter <Haley<5>>. She nods at you curiously, but doesn't seem to object to your presence.";
         } :else_if (!day1_haley_done) {

on_tick {
   #
   # Progress prompts
   #

   :if (!inventory_prompted && !is_at("outside")) {
      :set_true "inventory_prompted";
      :print "(To look in your inventory, type <INV<14>>.)";
   }

   :if (!day1_slept && phone_message_read && day1_daniel_done && day1_haley_done && day1_joyce_done && day1_nora_done) {
      :print "You're feeling sleepy. Maybe you should head to <bed<5>>?";
   }

   :if (night1_awake && !night1_slept) {
      :if (is_carried("button") && !is_present("sound") && !(night1_sound_recorded && !night1_sound_played)) {
         :print "You're quite tired now. Maybe head back to <bed<5>>?";
      } :else_if (night1_sound_recorded && night1_sound_played) {
         :print "You're seriously exhausted now. Maybe try to get some sleep?";
      }
   }

   :if (is_holding("clock_paper") && is_holding("hutch_paper") && is_holding("painting_paper") && !night2_papers_found) {
      :set_true "night2_papers_found";
      :print "There <poem<4>> has three verses... and now you have three pieces of <paper<4>>... maybe <EXAMINE THE PAPER<14>> again?";
   }

   #
   # Action triggers
   #

   :if (is_at("hidden_room") && is_holding("necklace") && is_holding("letter") && !night2_daniel_threatening && !night2_daniel_conked && !night2_slept) {
      :create "daniel";
      :set_true "night2_daniel_threatening";
      :update_graphic;
      :print "There is a rustling behind you and the room seems to darken even more. <Daniel<5>> appears! He is holding a <gun<5>>.";
      :press_any_key;
      :print "\"I can't believe you found it...\" he says incredulously.";
      :press_any_key;
      :return;
   }

   :if (is_at("cellar") && night2_daniel_conked && !night2_slept) {
      :set_true "night2_slept";
      :set_false "night2_daniel_conked";
      :destroy "daniel";
      :destroy "necklace";
      :create "haley" target="kitchen";
      :create "joyce" target="lobby";
      :create "nora" target="dining_room";

      :print "As you stand in shock, you hear footsteps coming downstairs.";
      :press_any_key;
      :print "It's <Joyce<5>> and <Haley<5>>. Their eyes widen at the scene.";
      :print "You take a deep breath. There is a lot of explaining to do.";
      :press_any_key;
      :print "The night is a blur.";
      :print "The police are called. <Daniel<5>> is arrested. It seems this is not his first offense.";
      :press_any_key;
      :print "Your statement is taken. When the <necklace<4>> comes up, <Joyce<5>> and <Haley<5>> both gasp. You give it to <Joyce<5>>. She is shocked beyond words.";
      :press_any_key;
      :print "You aren't sure how to explain ghostly doors flying open, but the police seem satisfied that <Daniel<5>> slipped in some water. <Joyce<5>> steps in though and insists you should get some rest.";
      :print "You can't help but agree, and gratefully head to your room.";
      :press_any_key;
      :goto "guest_room_3";
      :redescribe;
      :return;
   }
}

#
# Commands
#

vocabulary {
   :adjective / aliases=[cell, mobile]
   :adjective / aliases=[creepy, eerie, spooky, weird]

   :noun / aliases=[cell, mobile, phone]
   :noun / aliases=[dan, daniel]
   :noun / aliases=[hotel, inn]
   :noun / aliases=[noise, sound]
   :noun / aliases=[letter, note]
   :noun / aliases=[woman, lady]

   :verb / aliases=[adjust, change, set, reset]
   :verb / aliases=[chat, greet, say, speak, talk, tell]
   :verb / aliases=[checkin, register]
   :verb / aliases=[check, examine, inspect, look, search, read, use]
   :verb / aliases=[move, push, shove, slide]
   :verb / aliases=[play, playback]
}

on_command {
   #
   # Special navigation commands
   #

   :if (is_at("lobby")) {
      :if (day2_daniel_done && day2_haley_done && day2_joyce_done && day2_nora_done && !night2_returned) {
         :match "exit -;east -;go east" {
            :success;
            :print "You head out of the inn and catch your ride to Gamecon.";
            :press_any_key;
            :print "The day is filled with panels, costume contests, and far too much money spent on the dealers room. You have a grand time catching up with friends and nerding out, but you can't help but feel eager to get back to the inn. There is clearly something going on, and you feel close to figuring it out!";
            :press_any_key;
            :set_true "night2_returned";
            :destroy "daniel";
            :destroy "haley";
            :destroy "joyce";
            :destroy "nora";
            :goto "outside";
            :redescribe;

            :press_any_key;
            :print "As you jaunt to the door, a cold breeze brushes past your neck. You glance back. For a moment, you could have sworn you saw <Nora<5>> walking up the stairs. But the Red Soldier Inn is as empty as ever. For now, at least...";
            :print "^c^YOU WIN!";

   #
   # General command rules
   #

   # Don't allow dropping objects.   
   :match "drop *" {
      :print "There's no need to put that down.";
      :done;
   }

   :match "unwear *" {
      :print "There's no need to take that off.";
      :done;
   }

   # Add some extra hints in the inventory.
   :match "inventory _" {
      :inventory;
      :if (!phone_used) {
         :print "Use <CHECK PHONE<14>> to check your <phone<4>>.";
      }
      :done;
   }

   # Treat all examine/look synonyms the same.
   :match "look -" {
      :redescribe;
      :done;
   }
}
